parametrized_description: A drop-in clinic is performing tests either through the ear or blood. Each blood test takes TimePerBloodTest minutes to perform while each ear test takes TimePerEarTest minutes. Since the blood test is more accurate, at least BloodToEarTestRatio times as many blood tests should be performed as ear tests. However, at least MinEarTests ear tests must be administered. If the drop-in clinic operates for TotalOperatingTime minutes, maximize the number of tests that can be performed.

TimePerBloodTest.description: Time required to perform a blood test in minutes

TimePerEarTest.description: Time required to perform an ear test in minutes

BloodToEarTestRatio.description: Minimum ratio of blood tests to ear tests

MinEarTests.description: Minimum number of ear tests to be administered

TotalOperatingTime.description: Total operating time of the clinic in minutes

NumberOfBloodTests.description: The number of blood tests to be administered

NumberOfEarTests.description: The number of ear tests to be administered

constraints.description: The total time required for blood tests plus ear tests does not exceed TotalOperatingTime minutes.
The number of blood tests is at least BloodToEarTestRatio times the number of ear tests.
At least MinEarTests ear tests must be administered.

objective.description: Maximize the total number of tests performed (blood tests plus ear tests).
